results.title: Death of a beauty = Mei ren zhi si
results.creator_credit: Guang Chunlan, Xin Shuxuan and Tianshan Film Studio
results.brief_description:
The film is based on an ancient legend taking place in Southern Xinjiang three hundred years ago. Mariam and her father lived in an old mansion. One day Mariam was singing on the balcony and her cousin incidentally saw her unveiled face, which terribly scared him. What had happened to Mariam was that two years ago when her father was seriously ill, he made a will saying that Mariam would inherit all his wealth. This enraged Mariam’s stepmother, who set a fire on the house and Mariam’s face was severely disfigured. Mariam’s stepmother had since controlled the mansion. During the Corban festival, the royal family, Yunus came to visit Mariam’s father. The prince, Kaisal surprisingly found out that the veiled Mariam was the little girl that he met on a hunting five years ago. Kaisal promised that he would marry Mariam. Soon Kaisal’s father sent people to propose the marriage, which put Mariam’s father into a difficult situation. Mariam’s stepmother drove Mariam off and made their servant, Palida pretend to be the bride. The kind-hearted Palida told Kaisal the truth and poisoned herself. Kaisal was furious about what had happened and went to look for Mariam. Kaisal found Mariam eventually but Mariam jumped off the cliff as she saw Kaisal running towards her. She did not want the prince to marry her who were no longer the girl he had met. Mariam’s stepmother died in a fire and the film ends in Kaisal holding Mariam walking on the desert in the sunset.

The film is directed by a female director, Guang Chunlan. Guang also produced The Mysterious Caravan (1985), The Girl Who Wanted to Dance (1983) and so on in the Tianshan Film Studio. Throughout the 1980s, Guang made a number of films representing the rich local culture and lifestyles in Xinjiang. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Deadly
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Richard Moir, Beyond Films and Moirstorm Productions
results.brief_description: To clear his name, disgraced city cop Tony Bourke (Jerome Ehlers) is sent to file a report on the “suicide” hanging of a local First Nations person in a remote outback gaol. His orders are to clean things up quickly and quietly but, in a town ready to explode with racial tension, Bourke uncovers a web of suspicion and the truth behind a deadly secret. A fast-paced thriller and intriguing and powerful story of conspiracy, cover-up and cold-blooded murder. Features Tony Barry and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Death flight 901: the Erebus disaster
results.creator_credit: John Keir, New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and Sonar Productions
results.brief_description: A film about the Air New Zealand DC10 plane crash at Mt Erebus in Antarctica on November 28, 1979 and the judicial process of apportioning blame. Includes footage of the wreckage and sequences filmed inside the courtroom at the Royal Commission of Inquiry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Keir, New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and Sonar Productions

results.title: Death and the maiden = Si shen yu shao nu
results.creator_credit: Lin Hongtong, Zhao Qihua and Beijing Film Academy
results.brief_description:
Synopsis:
An old man committed suicide as he realized he had no more than three months to live because of liver cancer. A 26-year old girl lost hope for life as one of her legs was amputated because of blood disease. Death and the Maiden tells the story of how an old man and a girl encouraged each other to fight against death and live life with hope. The old man, a writer, condemns the doctor for saving his life as this would only make him suffer in his final days of life. However, the old man promised to live on in order to help a young lady he encountered in the hospital to survive the hardship in her life and marry her boyfriend. The liver cancer took the old man’s life eventually and the girl lost the other leg. However, after the old man’s death, the girl is determined to live life with hope. The film ends in the girl’s boyfriend pushing a wheelchair for her, both full of hope for a new life together.

Cultural History of the Film:
The screenwriter of the film, Shi Tiesheng, is a well-known writer in China and Shi is himself a disabled person and wheel-chair bound. The film was devoted to the UN Decade of Disabled Persons, 1983-1992.

Researcher’s Comments:
In the 1980s and 1990s, the Chinese government set up various role models, among which a most famous is a disabled lady, Zhang Haidi, to encourage people, particularly young people, to have firm belief in the socialist course. This film is produced in such a background and reflects the Chinese film authorities’ view that a primary function of film is to educate people.

Additional Information:
Good cinematography and editing.

(3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: Deadlock
results.brief_description: The film starts when Anna (played by Kerry Fox) has called the police to arrest her defacto Serge (played by Raj Sidhu). The film explores their relationship and how the violent tendencies of Serge develop and worsen over time. The line has been crossed. What was frustration and anger has been revealed to be a pattern of violent behaviour. Anna observes this and decides to take action, albeit not soon enough.

results.title: Revolution of necessity
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
The discovery of how to turn coke into fuel launches the Industrial Revolution. The need for better pumps in the mines eventually leads to the steam engine, which together with the railway transforms society. Bessemer’s converter gives the world cheap steel.

results.title: Into the machine age
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
The ever expanding American iron and steel industry spawns the railroads that help to reunify a country riven by civil war. In the aftermath of the Chicago fire on 1871, the industry creates the steel-framed skycraper. The discovery of vast reserves of oil, and the advent of mass production, mark the last quarter of the nineteenth century.

results.title: Deadline
results.creator_credit: Nash Edgerton and Blue Tongue Films
results.brief_description: Drummoyne 4.50 pm - a young man races across various Sydney suburbs, headed for Kings Cross, at a furiously reckless pace. Accompanied by a rocking punk-skater soundtrack this Australian short film amuses greatly with its almost dialogue-less encounters and frenetic pace. Cast includes Nash Edgerton and John Polson.

results.title: From alchemy to the atom
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode six from “Out of the Fiery Furnace.” Scientists of the 20th century discover how to to transform matter not into gold but into energy. European scientists work towards an understanding of atoms and the energy they release.

results.title: From stone to bronze
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode 1 in the fascinating series called “Out of the fiery furnace.” Opening in the Stone Age this episode explores how mankind came to recognize metals, showing their accidental production in an Indian pottery kiln, and an experiment in smelting copper in the Sinai using Egyptian techniques of about 1500 BC.
